intro: Carludovica labela, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and twining. Carludovica labela is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
